**Describe the bug**
```
cpdef (int,int,float) make(int a, int b, float c):
    cdef (int,int,float) x = a,b,c
    return x
```
```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cpdef (int,int,float) make(int a, int b, float c):
    cdef (int,int,float) x = a,b,c
                            ^
------------------------------------------------------------

testm.pyx:2:29: Cannot assign type 'int' to '(int, int, float)'
```

The above fails with the above error.

```
cpdef (int,int,float) make(int a, int b, float c):
    cdef (int,int,float) x
    x = a,b,c
    return x
```

This on the other hand works.

**Expected behavior**
That the assignment should succeed during cdef.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Win 10
 - Python version: 3.8.5
 - Cython version: 0.29.21

comment_data.body: Let me just note that this is not the only wonky tuple assignment thing. `cdef object x = a,b,c` will raise an error as well. When I opened this issue, I had not realized that type definitions in if statements are not allowed and have since then factored out type definitions from their uses in [Spiral](https://github.com/mrakgr/The-Spiral-Language)' s Cython backend. So this issue is not problematic for me anymore.

title: [BUG] cdef tuple assignment does not work during the definition
